class.name: Gradient
class.brief_description: A color interpolator resource which can be used to generate colors between user-defined color points.
class.description: Given a set of colors, this resource will interpolate them in order. This means that if you have color 1, color 2 and color 3, the gradient will interpolate from color 1 to color 2 and from color 2 to color 3. The gradient will initially have 2 colors (black and white), one (black) at gradient lower offset 0 and the other (white) at the gradient higher offset 1. See also [Curve] which supports more complex easing methods, but does not support colors.

method.name: add_point
method.description: Adds the specified color to the end of the ramp, with the specified offset.

method.name: get_color
method.description: Returns the color of the ramp color at index [code]point[/code].

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Returns the offset of the ramp color at index [code]point[/code].

method.name: get_point_count
method.description: Returns the number of colors in the ramp.

method.name: interpolate
method.description: Returns the interpolated color specified by [code]offset[/code].

method.name: remove_point
method.description: Removes the color at the index [code]point[/code].

method.name: set_color
method.description: Sets the color of the ramp color at index [code]point[/code].

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Sets the offset for the ramp color at index [code]point[/code].

members.member: Defines how the colors between points of the gradient are interpolated. See [enum InterpolationMode] for available modes.

constants.constant: Constant interpolation, color changes abruptly at each point and stays uniform between. This might cause visible aliasing when used for a gradient texture in some cases.
